1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
near, with or among; often in general, to
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

2.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

3.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to gleam, i.e. (causatively) embellish; figuratively, to boast; also to explain (i.e. make clear) oneself; to shake a tree

4.brief: emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
properly, to gasp; hence, to be exhausted, to tire, to toil
a desolation (of surface), i.e. desert; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, conservative; but used passively, delivered

something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

to surround, i.e. protect or aid
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)

to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
bareness; concretely, a bare hill or plain
